name: Royal Oak Appleby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was very good quality. After that it is downhill all the way.
reviews.title: Beware the Dread Room 3

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a cheap deal but was assured a 4* bedroom. The en suite was a joke. It must be up front for the smallest and smelliest ever prize. This, plus the rest of the residential areas were of very low quality, tatty and dirty. Try the pub loos! How this place has four stars is beyond us. Yes, the food is good, but be very wary of hotel rating systems. This the worst accomodation we have stayed in 40 years. The climbing club huts I use have far higher standards at £5 a night.
reviews.title: Fantastic - Cooking Fantastic! ;0)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area is great and so is the town. A good place to eat, but you may be better off staying in the local doss house.
reviews.title: A totally unexpected treat - Mal-style rooms in a country inn!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beinn Eighe.
reviews.title: We will be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a fantastic find! A really fabulous inn, well kept beers, surprisingly stylish and comfortable bedrooms, excellent food, lovely welcoming staff, cosy real fires, superb landlady, hilarious friendly locals who didn't mind us sitting in their seats - what more can you ask for apart from to go back very soon!!
reviews.title: Very disappointed!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just spent 3 nights at this fabulous old inn!
reviews.title: what a fabulous old inn and a lovely break!

reviews.text: We had room number 7 which is a superior double! it was a really lovely room, flat screen tv, very modern decor and a huge bed which was very very comfortable. The bathroom had everything we needed even bubble bath!
reviews.title: Warm and welcoming!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despit it being an old inn the rooms was very warm and cosy!
reviews.title: Even better second time around

reviews.text: The only downside to the room was the wardrobe space! this was not adequate for 2 people especially for outdoor clothing boots etc . There was a leather sofa in the room which we never sat on once, this was taking up the much need wardrobe space! but despite that it was a beautiful room, well thought out for guests needs!
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: The breadkfast which was included was to a very high standard, and was serverd quickly, with choice of cereals and juices and newspapers!
reviews.title: A Wonderful Stay
Nice
reviews.text: A one night stay for Mrs Localshopper and myself.

We were welcomed by Kyle and shown to a well appointed room with a huge and very comfortable bed. Enjoyed excellent beer (Hawkshead Brewery) outside on a sunny afternoon and excellent food inside during the evening.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kyle & Jan obviously care a lot and work very hard a running this establishment.
reviews.title: Lovely Eating Place

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay very much and will return.
reviews.title: Great pub food in a great atmosphere!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just had a 2 night stay and had an excellent time, Kyle and Jan are very hard working and obliging which certainly rubs off on their Staff who where all in the same mode and always with a smile, it really does make a difference to your stay. The Food was excellent in the very nice restaurant. The Rooms where very nice the only small issue was the carpets on the stairs as you go upstairs are a little worn but they are currently doing refurb on that. We walked from the Inn all the time so the car just stayed outside, it is good walking country.
reviews.title: Lovely place, great location, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived in Appleby expecting it to be bustling following the horse fair at the weekend. It was like a ghost town! There is nowhere decent in town to go for a drink. Went for a nice walk along the river near the Royal Oak - which was best bit of our stay. Had dinner in Royal Oak - The hubbies Rack of Lamb (two chops) was ok, my steak was like a kids meal!!!!!
reviews.title: Wont be going back!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wont be going back again!
reviews.title: Little Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last minute decision to have an overnight stay in North Cumbria. Went onto Late Rooms website and this place came up. Previous reviews were all very positive. The pub is about a mile outside Appleby on B6542. Traditional appearance from the outside and lovely atmosphere in public areas inside. Bar area trendy and surprisingly small. Restaurant fairly minimalist though decorated with thought and good quality furnishing.
reviews.title: REALLY NICE VISIT

reviews.text: Welcome was warm, very friendly and very efficient. Taken up narrow staircase to first floor corridor, neither of which had had 'the treatment' i.e. a bit rickety, old fashioned slightly careworn carpet, walls Anaglypta. What a surprise then, to enter a bedroom that was bang 'on trend' in every respect. Though smallish it had great design, great quality furnishings and linen, and lovely decoration. The bathroom was super. We had the added bonus of having french windows that opened onto the garden.
reviews.title: What a shame

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner brought an imaginative menu with lovely food, varied wine list and very good service. One had the feeling throughout that staff were happy to have you there and they knew what they were doing. Breakfast was equally efficient. Normal 'Full English' routine, my only disappointment being that they had those little foil butter pats which seemed to go against the grain of the style of this place.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel in Appleby

description: Appleby Locals Kyle & Jan took over the Royal Oak in April 2006, following a ground floor lounge & restaurant refurbishment the hotel & pub has been re-launched. The Royal Oak is situated in the heart of the Eden Valley in the historic market town, Appleby in Westmorland less than 10 minutes from junction 40 southbound and 38 northbound of the M6. This traditional coaching inn boasts 9 En-suite rooms and its very own Holiday Cottage.
